alert.note: Alert for Mississippi; New Madrid (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 16 at 4:39AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Patchy slick spots on area roadways this morning... A light dusting of snow that fell overnight will cause patchy slick spots on some roadways in far southeast Missouri and western Kentucky this morning. The Kentucky State Police Post in Mayfield reported that roads south of Mayfield were slick early this morning, with patchy slick spots in the city of Mayfield. This same scenario likely exists along a corridor from New Madrid Missouri to Clinton, Hickman, Mayfield, Benton, Eddyville, Princeton, Dawson Springs, Nortonville, and Greenville in western Kentucky, where light snow has accumulated. Surfaces most likely to be impacted include untreated and secondary roadways in addition to bridges and overpasses. However, patchy slick spots are also possible on the main thoroughfares. Please check road conditions before you travel. And if you do travel early this morning, drive slowly and give yourself some extra time to reach your destination.
